1.verse: Moreover the LORD answered Job, and said,

2.verse: Shall he that contendeth with the Almighty instruct him? he that reproveth God, let him answer it.

3.verse: Then Job answered the LORD, and said,

4.verse: Behold, I am vile; what shall I answer thee? I will lay mine hand upon my mouth.

5.verse: Once have I spoken; but I will not answer: yea, twice; but I will proceed no further.

6.verse: Then answered the LORD unto Job out of the whirlwind, and said,

7.verse: Gird up thy loins now like a man: I will demand of thee, and declare thou unto me.

8.verse: Wilt thou also disannul my judgment? wilt thou condemn me, that thou mayest be righteous?

9.verse: Hast thou an arm like God? or canst thou thunder with a voice like him?

10.verse: Deck thyself now with majesty and excellency; and array thyself with glory and beauty.

11.verse: Cast abroad the rage of thy wrath: and behold every one that is proud, and abase him.

12.verse: Look on every one that is proud, and bring him low; and tread down the wicked in their place.

13.verse: Hide them in the dust together; and bind their faces in secret.

14.verse: Then will I also confess unto thee that thine own right hand can save thee.

15.verse: Behold now behemoth, which I made with thee; he eateth grass as an ox.

16.verse: Lo now, his strength is in his loins, and his force is in the navel of his belly.

17.verse: He moveth his tail like a cedar: the sinews of his stones are wrapped together.

18.verse: His bones are as strong pieces of brass; his bones are like bars of iron.

19.verse: He is the chief of the ways of God: he that made him can make his sword to approach unto him.

20.verse: Surely the mountains bring him forth food, where all the beasts of the field play.

21.verse: He lieth under the shady trees, in the covert of the reed, and fens.

22.verse: The shady trees cover him with their shadow; the willows of the brook compass him about.

23.verse: Behold, he drinketh up a river, and hasteth not: he trusteth that he can draw up Jordan into his mouth.

24.verse: He taketh it with his eyes: his nose pierceth through snares.
